726669f-a.title: Queens: 111th Street - 51st Avenue
726669f-a.text:
Flushing Meadow Park (2ueens): Three of the industrial
exhibits at the New ork World's Fair 1939-40. View 1 shows
the Ford Motor Comnany Butlding, on the west side of Grand
Central Parkway, and the statue 'Samson and the Lion,'' by the
sculptor Benjamin Hawkins.
View 2 shows the Aviation Building (right) and the
South Corona gate to the Fair, on the east side of 111th Street
and 53rd Avenue. The building suggests a plane with its nose
stuck inside a hangar. The architects are William Lescaze and
J. G. Carr.
In view 3 is the Railroads Building, viewing north along
the east side of 111th Street from 51st Avenue.
View 1: Say 29, 1939
Viewc2,3: June 23, 1940
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

725794f-a.title: Queens: 111th Street - 51st Avenue
725794f-a.text:
111th Street, at the N.W. corner of 51st Avenue. The
parking space is for visitors to the New York World's Fair of
1939-40. Practically every empty lot in this area was converted
into a parking space for the duration of the Fair.
P. L. Sperr  June 23, 1940
NO REPRODUCTIONS
